content.description: Purple Heart is a brilliant route up the steep South Face of this incredible feature. Climb up three bolts of easy climbing to a no hand stance and pedestal below the pillar. The first couple bolts from here are pretty straightforward crimping up a seam, and then a couple small edges take you to a left hand sloper ball at the third bolt. The crux is the next couple moves up and right to a little spike and beyond. This is absolutely worth it for the incredible position and excellent rock on this unique feature.
content.protection:
7 bolts to a one bolt anchor (no chains) over the lip. Make sure to bring a longer draw or sling to lower from that one bolt (you can back it up with the pin and nut that are fixed up there too), and then I would recommend climbing '

Point of Honor

,' 5.5, on the other side to clean your final draw (it's an easy solo). Plus the

Point of Honor

route is just awesome to begin with.
content.location: It is just down from 'Woodstone' and on top of the Slot Rock crag.

content.description:
This large boulder is perched enticingly off the N end of Slot rock.  Perhaps all of 30 feet, this is worth the effort for the sheer fun of it, especially if you're gonna climb other routes in the area.  This has been photographed in one of Gillett's guides.

Enjoy face climbing up on good rock the N face.  Find a couple wire placements.  Head to the top.  Harder routes exist on the other faces of this block.

Rap off pin and wire 30-40 ft to the North.

This enjoyable route is located on the NE side of Slot rock. The climbing is fairly straightforward for the grade and relies more on good foot work than powerful tugs. This is a good route to start or finish your day on, since there are no other routes in the area (

Eds. it is now the middle of three routes)

.
content.location: This route is located halfway up the north side of the formation.

pathTokens: Woodstone, Half & Half, and Slot Rock
